data.title: 541 Area Code - Get a Eugene, OR Local Phone Number

data.text:

541 phone number

Having a local number gives you a leg up on the national competition. You can instantly be part of the community here in Oregon. Many people are more likely to pick up a phone call from an area code they recognize.

You can connect with customers in area code 541’s major city, Eugene, Oregon, with a population of 176,654. The area code also covers: Eugene, Bend, Corvallis, Medford, Pendleton, and all of Oregon except metropolitan northwestern Oregon, including Portland, Salem, Astoria, etc..

With an increasing demand for new phone numbers, area code 541 is an overlay of area code 458. These area codes touch 27 counties in total. That includes counties like Lane, Jackson, Deschutes, Douglas, Linn, Benton, Josephine, Umatilla, Klamath, and Coos.

There are lots of area codes in close range, like 208/986 (Idaho), 360/564 (Vancouver, WA), 503/971 (Portland, OR), 509 (Spokane, WA), 530 (Redding, CA), 707 (Santa Rosa, CA), and 775 (Reno, NV).

Connecting to your customers in

area code 541

Looking to get a lay of the land on the economic landscape of Oregon before you get an area code 541 business phone number? Here are a few key facts to keep in mind:

Area code 541 is in the Pacific Standard Time. In this corner of Oregon, you’ll find the area code’s biggest city, Eugene, in Lane County.

Lane County has an unemployment rate of 7.9% and a mean household income of $75,608. The population within Eugene’s city limits increased by 0.05% from 2019 to 2020.

Many in Eugene have recently started businesses. During the same period, the number of new business applications in Eugene dropped a whopping -1%. Their prospects are optimistic since Oregon’s startup survival rate is 77.60%. Sure, many entrepreneurs here are diving into the future of work in new and innovative ways. But there are also big players established in this large city.

The top ten employers in Eugene, OR are University of Oregon, Peacehealth, Lane Community College, 4J School District, City of Eugene, Lane County, Symantec, Oregon Medical Group, Pacificsource Health Plans, State of Oregon.

They represent some of the significant sectors of the area. According to census.gov, Eugene’s most powerful industries are:

Educational services, and health care and social assistance

Retail trade

Professional, scientific, and management, and administrative and waste management services
